dateline.placeName: Royal Hotel Edinburgh.CD was in Edinburgh, 22 June-4 July, where he was given a dinner in his honour, 25 June, and voted the Freedom of the City, 29 June: see further Pilgrim Letters 2, pp. 310-11, 313-15 & nn.

body.p: I am heartily obliged to you for your kind Invitation, forwarded to me through your brother William,William Jerdan (1782-1869; Dictionary of National Biography); editor in London of the Literary Gazette, 1817-50. An early contributor to Bentley’s Miscellany; met CD apparently through Ainsworth: see further Pilgrim Letters 1, p. 207n. and write to thank you for it – though I very much regret to add that the arrangementsCD was heavily engaged in Edinburgh until Sunday 4 July, when he left by previous arrangement for a fortnight in the Highlands. He also wrote Master Humphrey’s Clock, Nos 69 and 70 (Barnaby Rudge, chs 45-48), while in Scotland. I have made and the short time I can spare from London, prevent my seeingWritten after “meeting” deleted. you, as I should have desired.
